intro: Citrullus colocynthis subsp. stenotomus, commonly known as the bitter apple or colocynth, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellowish-green, spiny fruits. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its fruits are toxic when mature but have been historically used in traditional medicine. The plant's botanical features include its distinctive fruit morphology and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
